title: Reform the Bank of England? Be careful what you wish for
text:
In Yes Minister – essential viewing for any student of British politics – hapless minister Jim Hacker would begin quivering with nerves if his wily civil servant Sir Humphrey Appleby described one of his decisions as “brave”. All the more so if Sir Humphrey went further and called it “courageous”.

The classic sitcom came to mind when reading the latest report from the Positive Money campaign group on the future of the Bank of England, called “Seeking Legitimacy”.

Cross-bench peer and Keynes biographer Lord Skidelsky and former Liberal Democrat leader Sir Vince Cable were among those who spoke at the launch, which comes at a transitional time for Threadneedle Street and a new Governor in the offing...
